pages.title: üß∞ What is a Loadout?
pages.description:
Your **Loadout** is what you bring into battle: a **Weapon** + a **Spell**.

Weapons affect your stats and give passives. Spells are your high-impact abilities that cost Mana.

If you feel like you‚Äôre losing even when you ""play well"", 90% of the time your loadout is the problem.

fields.name: Equip / Change Loadout
fields.value:
Use: `/loadout <weapon> <spell>`

Examples:
`/loadout training_blade fireball`
`/loadout moon_slasher frostbite`
`/loadout elephant_hammer erdtree_blessing`

fields.name: How loadout affects battles
fields.value:
‚Ä¢ modifies your stats (HP/Attack/Defense/Speed/Mana)
‚Ä¢ unlocks weapon passives
‚Ä¢ determines what your **Cast** stance does

You can‚Äôt win matchups by ""skill"" alone if your loadout has no win-condition.

pages.title: üèÜ Loadout Tips (Noob ‚Üí Menace)
pages.description: A few player-facing fundamentals that will instantly improve your winrate:

fields.name: 1) Pick a win condition
fields.value:
Don‚Äôt just equip random stuff. Decide how you want to win:
‚Ä¢ scale Attack (Training Blade)
‚Ä¢ stack Frost (Moon Slasher + Frostbite)
‚Ä¢ outheal/outtank (Elephant Hammer + Erdtree)
‚Ä¢ drain stats (Nightfall + Eternal Tome)

fields.name: 2) Mana is a resource
fields.value: If you spam Cast early, you‚Äôll run out and lose. Save mana for **high-value moments**.

fields.name: 3) Don‚Äôt counter the wrong thing
fields.value: Counter is strongest when the enemy is predictable. If you‚Äôre guessing randomly, you‚Äôre gambling (and not even earning gold for it).

fields.name: 4) Your gear changes your rhythm
fields.value:
Fast weapons win speed wars. Tank weapons win long wars.
If you fight against your weapon‚Äôs strength, you‚Äôre nerfing yourself.
